intro: Agallochum sylvestre, commonly known as the wild agalloch, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and glossy, elliptical leaves. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, this plant thrives in shaded, moist environments. The plant produces small, black berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological and medicinal studies.
